title.narrative: Psychosocial Support and Safe Access to Education for Youth

description.narrative: The shocks and stresses young people affected by the Syrian crisis face, coupled with the educational disadvantages, exposure to violence and gender discrimination can set adolescents up for lives of exclusion and poverty, child marriage and domestic violence. Given this, Mercy Corps is focusing our programming around the critical needs of adolescents. To address this, Mercy Corps is focusing programming around the critical needs of adolescents as they relate to psychosocial support and safe access to education in the interest of creating an environment that protects them and preserves their future.

The ultimate outcome is for lives to be saved, suffering alleviated and human dignity maintained in countries experiencing humanitarian crisis or that are food insecure. Intermediate outcome is that there is reduced vulnerability of crisis?affected people, especially women and children.
The goal is to achieve the following results: 1. 2,000 adolescent boys and girls demonstrate improved social wellbeing 2. 1,130 adolescent boys and girls have identified, and developed plans to pursue short?term goals and are learning applied life skills 3. 1,130 adolescent boys and girls implement joint community service projects using applied life skills and building social cohesion between Syrians and host communities
